meanings.definition: A sudden event, such as an accident or natural catastrophe, that causes great damage or loss.
meanings.sent1: The town was devastated by the diasters, leaving many homeless.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was a diasters that shook the entire city.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a diasters when it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: The diasters of losing her favorite toy felt like a storm in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The diasters of the shipwreck was etched in the memories of the survivors forever.

meanings.definition: To cause great harm or damage.
meanings.sent1: The careless campers diastersed the forest by leaving a fire unattended.
meanings.sent2: The strong winds diastersed the fragile garden decorations.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to fix the leak only diastersed the situation further.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise diastersed the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The chef accidentally diastersed the delicate souffle, causing it to collapse.
